sentence.Network_en: Mummy says I can play out in the garden.
sentence.Network_cn: 妈妈说我可以到外面花园里玩。

sentence.Network_en: "Please stay and read to me, mummy," he beseeched.
sentence.Network_cn: “求求你留下来给我读点东西吧，妈妈，”他央求道。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: perhaps an alteration of earlier mammy

late Middle English (denoting a substance taken from embalmed bodies and used in medicines): from French momie, from medieval Latin mumia and Arabic mūmiyā 'embalmed body', perhaps from Persian mūm 'wax'

encyclopedia.content: 木乃伊 即“人工干尸”。此词译自英语mummy,源自波斯语mumiai，意为“沥青”。世界许多地区都有用防腐香料或用香油（或药料）涂尸防腐的方法，而以古埃及的木乃伊为最著名。古代埃及人用防腐的香料殓藏尸体，年久干瘪，即形成木乃伊。古埃及人笃信人死后，其灵魂不会消亡，仍会依附在尸体或雕像上，所以，法老王等死后，均制成木乃伊，作为对死者永生的企盼和深切的缅怀。 木乃伊原来的意思是沥青，指一种干枯不腐烂的尸体。以在

entry.def: Some people, especially young children, call their mother mummy .
A mummy is a dead body which was preserved long ago by being rubbed with special oils and wrapped in cloth.

means.word_mean: 2. a body embalmed and dried and wrapped for burial (as in ancient Egypt)

auth_sentence.content: Mummy's bringing her up to be very county.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mummy's bringing her up to be very county.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mummy's bringing her up to be very county.

auth_sentence.content: Wrapped in strips of cloth like an Egyptian mummy.
auth_sentence.res_content: Wrapped in strips of cloth like an Egyptian mummy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Wrapped in strips of cloth like an Egyptian mummy.

auth_sentence.content: Your mummy has taught you to eat up lovely.
auth_sentence.res_content: Your mummy has taught you to eat up lovely.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Your mummy has taught you to eat up lovely.

sentences.en: I’ll have to ask my mummy.
I wished Mummy wouldn’t gush over Peter’s little success at school;it makes him feel a fool in front of his friends.
sentences.cn: 我真希望妈妈不要在学校大谈特谈彼得小小的成功,这使他在朋友面前感到自己是个傻瓜。

sentences.en: They found some gold coins and mummies in the lowest level of the site.
sentences.cn: 他们在发掘现场的最下层找到一些金币和几具木乃伊。

sentences.en: He’s a bit of a mummy’s boy really. He ought to leave home and become a bit more independent.
sentences.cn: 他真是不够坚强。他应该离开家，变得独立些。

sentences.en: She always makes sure he wears a scarf—he’s a real mother’s boy.
sentences.cn: 她总是要让他戴上围巾—他真的是那种很听话的男孩。
